    AE Assessment - ADaM Mapping

    AE_Map_Adam.Rd

    Convert from ADaM format to input format for Safety Assessment.

    AE_Map_Adam(dfADSL, dfADAE, mapping = NULL, bQuiet = TRUE)

    Arguments

    dfADSL

    ADaM demographics data with the following required columns: USUBJID, SITEID, TRTEDT (end date), TRTSDT (start date)

    dfADAE

    ADaM AE data with the following required columns: USUBJID

    mapping

    List containing expected columns in each data set. By default, mapping for dfAE is: strIDCol = "SUBJID". By default, mapping for dfRDSL is: strIDCol = "SubjectID", strSiteCol = "SiteID", and strExposureCol = "TimeOnTreatment". TODO: add more descriptive info or reference to mapping.

    bQuiet

    Default is TRUE, which means warning messages are suppressed. Set to FALSE to see warning messages.

    Value

    Data frame with one record per person data frame with columns: SubjectID, SiteID, Count (Number of Adverse Events), Exposure (Time on Treatment in Days), Rate (AEs/Day)

    Details

    This function maps from ADaM ADSL and ADAE data to the required input for AE_Assess.

    Data Specification

    This function creates an input dataset for the Adverse Event Assessment (AE_Assess) by adding Adverse Event Counts (from dfADAE) to basic subject-level data (from dfADSL).

    The following columns are required:

    • dfADSL

      • USUBJID - Unique subject ID

      • SITEID - Site ID

      • TRTEDT - Treatment End date

      • TRTSDT - Treatment Start date

    • dfADAE

      • USUBJID - Unique subject ID

    Note that the function can generate data summaries for specific types of AEs by passing filtered ADAE data to dfADAE.

    Examples

    dfInput <- AE_Map_Adam( safetyData::adam_adsl, safetyData::adam_adae )
